data.Name: LECO
data.Description: LECO refers to a method using equipment from LECO Corporation, which typically involves the determination of carbon, hydrogen, and nitrogen content in organic and inorganic samples through combustion analysis. This method is widely used in geochemical analyses to evaluate the organic content of rock samples.

data.Name: HAWK
data.Description: HAWK is a pyrolysis technique that involves heating rock samples to thermally extract hydrocarbons, providing insights into the quantity and type of hydrocarbons that can be generated from the rock under natural subsurface conditions.

data.Name: Rock Eval 2
data.Description: Rock Eval 2 is an early version of the Rock-Eval pyrolysis system, which provides rapid screening of rock samples to assess their hydrocarbon potential and thermal maturity by measuring the amount of hydrocarbons released upon heating and the temperature at which these releases occur.

data.Name: Rock Eval 6
data.Description: Rock Eval 6 is an advanced version of the Rock-Eval pyrolysis system that offers enhanced capabilities for analyzing source rocks, including detailed assessments of hydrocarbon generation potential, kinetic parameters, and the ability to distinguish between oil and gas-prone sources.

data.Name: Rock Eval 7
data.Description: Rock Eval 7 provides refined analysis capabilities, including improved detection limits and the ability to analyze both solid and liquid samples for comprehensive geochemical characterization.

data.Name: Oil Show Analyser
data.Description: The Oil Show Analyser is a tool used to detect and quantify the presence of hydrocarbons in rock samples during drilling operations, helping to identify productive zones and evaluate the potential of the reservoir.
